member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.summary: Add a point to the strip chart. If more than the history size are already in the chart, extras are dropped.

member.summary: Clear all of the points from the chart

member.summary: Display the last value sent to the chart, in the upper right.

member.summary: Display the mean and standard deviation, graphically.

member.summary: Title to display in the chart. Null for none.

member.summary: The size of points, when in point style. Ignored otherwise.

member.summary: Chart drawing style.

member.summary: Initial minimum value shown

member.summary: Initial maximum value shown

member.summary: Reset min and max as necessary to show all points. This must be set before adding any points.

member.summary: Draw labels with min and max of chart. Useful with AutoSize set to true.

member.name: T:muzzle.Litmus
member.summary:
Litmus is like StripChart, but shows a graphical representation of protocol going by. This was inspired by DW & Craig's suggestion that the next generation protocol should just be shades of blue.
Good gracious. Did I really take the time to write this?

member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.summary: Clear all data in the window

member.summary: Add a string to the window. Each byte will become roughly a pixel with color based on the byte's value.

member.summary: Add bytes to the window. Each byte will become roughly a pixel with color based on the byte's value.

member.summary: Color scheme to use.

member.summary: Number of points to show. -1 means all

member.summary: Don't update the display for now. Useful for bulk loads.
